title: Cryptography: The Fundamental Pillar of Blockchain
summary: This article explores the evolution and foundations of cryptography, from its origins in ancient Egypt to its crucial role in blockchain technology. We begin with a historical journey that includes Egyptian hieroglyphics and Caesar cipher, accompanied by practical implementations in Python. We examine the modern principles established by Claude Shannon and the CIA security triad (Confidentiality, Integrity, and Authenticity). The central part of the article delves into how modern cryptography underpins blockchain technology through techniques such as hashing, symmetric and asymmetric encryption, illustrated with practical code examples. This 40-minute tutorial provides a solid understanding of how cryptography has evolved to become the fundamental pillar of security and trust in blockchain systems.

title: Criptografía: El pilar fundamental del Blockchain
summary: Este artículo explora la evolución y fundamentos de la criptografía, desde sus orígenes en el antiguo Egipto hasta su papel crucial en la tecnología blockchain. Comenzamos con un recorrido histórico que incluye los jeroglíficos egipcios y el cifrado César, acompañado de implementaciones prácticas en Python. Se examinan los principios modernos establecidos por Claude Shannon y la triada de seguridad CIA (Confidencialidad, Integridad y Autenticidad). La parte central del artículo profundiza en cómo la criptografía moderna sustenta la tecnología blockchain a través de técnicas como el hashing, cifrado simétrico y asimétrico, ilustradas con ejemplos prácticos de código. Este tutorial de 40 minutos proporciona una comprensión sólida de cómo la criptografía ha evolucionado para convertirse en el pilar fundamental de la seguridad y confianza en los sistemas blockchain.

title: Zero-Shot Text Classification
summary: Zero-Shot Text Classification (ZSTC) is a machine learning technique that allows models to classify texts into categories without having been previously trained on those specific categories. It uses pre-trained language models, such as BART or GPT, which have learned to understand semantic relationships between words and phrases during their pre-training. This approach allows the model to generalize its knowledge and make inferences about new categories based on a given text, without the need for labeled examples.

title: Division Algorithm
summary: A division algorithm is a process that divides one number (called the dividend) by another number (called the divisor) and obtains the quotient and remainder of the division. A division algorithm can be implemented in Python using a while loop and subtracting the divisor from the dividend in each iteration. Knowing how a division algorithm works and how to implement it on our own is useful for understanding better how divisions work and can be useful in situations where we cannot use predefined libraries or functions.
